In addition, once as an action you can cast the Foresight spell regardless if you have the spell prepared or not. Doing so still spends the spell slot. When you cast the spell in this way, it only lasts for 1 minute instead of its normal duration. Once you do so you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

monster.name: Starlight Companion

hp.special: PB + 2 times your Fate Weaver level

languages: and the languages of its creator

trait.name: Companion's Bond
entries: The Starlight Companion cannot be {@condition charmed} by creatures other than its summoner. The Starlight Companion gets another use of its Starlight Wish per day when its summoner reaches 6th and 10th levels.

trait.name: Companion's Tether
entries: The Starlight Companion can be no further than 60 ft away from its summoner, or it begins to lose hit points. It loses 5 hit points if it starts its turn more than 60 ft away from its summoner. If it is reduced to 0 hit points in this manner, it is destroyed. While the Starlight Companion is within 30 ft of its summoner, both the summoner and the companion regains 1 hit point, so long as one of them has half of their remaining hit points or less. Whenever a spell or magical effect that lasts longer than one round is cast on its Summoner, the Starlight Companion shares the same magical effect.

action.name: Bless (1/rest)
entries: The Starlight Companion casts {@spell bless} as a 1st level spell. Its summoner becomes an automatic target of the spell, and the other two targets must be creatures friendly to its summoner. Once this spell is cast in this way, it cannot be cast again until its summoner completes a short or long rest even if a new Starlight Companion is summoned.

action.name: Starlight Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) radiant damage.

action.name: Starlight Wish (1/Day)
entries: The Starlight Companion asks you or a creature friendly to you what they desire. It will do its best to accomplish this wish, whatever that may be. Choose one of the following effects to grant: that creature receives healing equal your fate weaver level plus your proficiency bonus; that creature removes one disease or poison afflicting it; that creature gains the benefit of the help action for 1 minute; that creature can teleport once up to 30 ft as a bonus action for the next minute, losing the ability to do so afterwards; that creature's speed is doubled for the next minute.

Anything beyond what is mentioned above is beyond what the starlight companion can grant. If a creature wished for an effect that lasts longer than one round, the effect is lost if the starlight companion is destroyed.

item.name: Divination Focus
entries: A fate weaver has the powers of divination and most use a special tool that allows them to see into the near future, recent past, or present time. Every fate weaver is proficient with a divination focus, but other spellcasters can use a Divination Focus if they are proficient with one.

A divination focus can take many different forms ranging from a blank deck of cards that can fit writing or pictures, a sphere with a die inside that provides a written response, a tarokka deck, or even a small candle stick that when used its smoke forms words or an image.

Regardless of the form the focus takes, you start a 10 minute ritual and ask a single question. You then make a Spellcasting ability check and add your proficiency bonus using the divination focus. In order to receive an accurate reading, you must make a DC 12 check, or a DC determined by the DM depending on the nature of your question. More specific questions usually incur a higher DC. If your check is successful, you receive a vague response up to 50 words in length. Alternatively, you can receive a visual representation and interpret the meaning of the message yourself. You can use a Divination Focus a number of times per day equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining expended uses daily at dawn.
